item.title: ENGINE DRIVEN GENERATOR SYSTEMS (IDG, GCU, GCB) – IDG REMOVED

numlitem.para: Generator Control Breaker (GCB), if inoperative, remains open,
For PW, if engine Air Oil Cooler (AOC) is operative, fuel tank temperature remains above -36°C throughout the flight, and
IDG is removed.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

placard.para: Placard affected GEN control switch "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: ENGINE DRIVEN GENERATOR SYSTEMS (IDG, GCU, GCB)
maintenance.para: Use the following procedures to deactivate the Integrated Drive Generator (IDG) when an IDG, Generator Control Unit (GCU), or Generator Control Breaker (GCB) system failure condition is indicated:

numlitem.para: If EICAS status message DRIVE DISC ___, indicating the IDG is positively disconnected, is not already displayed, do the following procedure to disconnect the IDG:
Apply APU or external power if not already accomplished (AMM 24-22-00/201).
Verify BATTERY switch, located on P5 overhead panel, is ON.
Verify STANDBY POWER switch, located on P5 overhead panel, is in AUTO position.
Position applicable GEN CONT switch, located on P5 overhead panel, to OFF.
Verify all BUS TIE switches, located on P5 overhead panel, are in AUTO and the BUS TIE ISLN lights are extinguished.

If associated failed GCB’s BUS TIE breaker ISLN light is illuminated with all BUS tie switches set to AUTO position, and both synchronous buses are powered, this indicates a failed closed generator control breaker. Dispatch is not allowed.
Start applicable engine (AMM 71-00-00/201).

caution.para: The remaining portion of this procedure should be accomplished with the applicable engine running to prevent damage to the drive disconnect assembly.
Do not depress IDG drive disconnect switch when speed is below minimum idle rpm. IDG may be damaged as a result of a incomplete disconnect.

numlitem.para: With applicable engine operating at idle rpm or above, pull guard on appropriate IDG DRIVE DISC switch and momentarily depress switch.
Observe DRIVE light, on DRIVE DISC switch, is illuminated.

Verify applicable EICAS advisory message >DRIVE DISC_ is displayed on the EICAS display. If the >DRIVE DISC_ message is not displayed with the aircraft on the ground, then remove the IDG per step 2 below.
Restore aircraft to required configuration.

caution.para: If the engine operates with the IDG disconnected for more than 50 hours, then the IDG input shaft ball bearing assembly should be removed and shop inspected for wear.

numlitem.para: If IDG fails to disconnect then the following removal procedure will need to be followed:
Remove the inoperative IDG from gearbox (AMM 24-11-01/401).
Ensure aircraft weight and balance information includes removal of the IDG. IDG weight and balance arm data is:

entry.para: Removed IDG Weight & Balance Arm Data

numlitem.para: For GE engines, the following procedure may be used to install IDG shaft plug and secure for dispatch, using deactivation/dispatch kit G24005-24:
Install IDG shaft plug:
Lubricate O-ring with engine oil.
Install plug into IDG drive spline on accessory gearbox and tighten plug nut.
Install IDG drive pad cover plate.
Place cover plate into the IDG Quick Attach-Detach (QAD) ring.
Tighten IDG QAD ring tension bolt to 240-264 pound-inches (27.1-29.8 N-m).
Using a soft mallet, firmly tap the edge of the QAD ring.

note.para: Tap ring only from 4 o’clock to 7 o’clock position, viewing from rear with tension bolt on left side.

numlitem.para: Re-tighten IDG QAD ring tension bolt same as step b) and install lockwire.
Connect the following on the IDG drive pad cover plate:
4 generator power cables to the dummy terminal studs.
2 electrical connectors to the dummy receptacles.
Over temperature drain tube, with bolt and cap. Install cap lockwire to the lug on cover plate.
Oil-in and oil-out tubes: Install tube assembly and tighten couplings on tubes. Clamp tube assembly to bracket on cover plate.
Close the left thrust reverser half (AMM 78-31-00/201).
